description: An Orphaned Boy sets out in search of adventure, but when a shipwreck lands him on an island where Dinosaurs and Humans coexist, he finds not only adventure but a family as well.
name: Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone

original_info.id: Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone_2005
original_info.name: Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone

review.name: Let's remember this is a KIDS movie
review.reviewBody:
If you're an adult watching this, you're going to hate it. Especially if you're a fan of the books. Seems to me, that's what the other reviewers were.

However, my 3-year old son, who happens to be a dinosaur fanatic, LOVES this movie. He's too young to be able to watch the mini-series or read the books. However, this was a great way to get him introduced to the Dinotopia world at his early age. No violence, no risqu√© dialogue, just wholesome child-friendly dinosaur fun. Why look for inconsistencies in a kid's movie? So it's not like the books - most kid's movies aren't.

My son has every word of this movie memorized - subsequently, so do I. If you have young children, especially those that like dinosaurs, this movie is perfect.

trailer.description: Home Video Trailer from Good Times Ent
trailer.name: Dinotopia: Quest for the Ruby Sunstone
